questions.text: Acids produce H⁺ ions in aqueous solution.
Acids release OH⁻ ions in water.
Rusting of iron does not require oxygen.
Galvanization is a method to prevent rusting.
Magnesium ribbon is cleaned before burning to remove the oxide layer.
The pH of pure water is 1.
Sodium Chloride is the chemical name of baking soda.
A neutralization reaction produces salt and water.
Hard water contains salts of calcium and magnesium.
Bases produce OH⁻ ions in water.
